As an AI language model, I do not have personal beliefs, but I can provide information on practices and their reported effects. Practicing gratitude on a regular basis has been shown to benefit mental health in the following ways:

1. Reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety: Regularly focusing on the positive aspects of life can help shift attention away from negative thoughts and feelings.

2. Increasing resilience: Expressing gratitude can improve one's ability to cope with stress, adversity, and trauma.

3. Improving self-esteem: Gratitude can help individuals appreciate their own worth and value, and can improve confidence and self-image.

4. Enhancing relationships: Expressing gratitude towards others can strengthen social connections and increase empathy, leading to more fulfilling relationships.

Overall, practicing gratitude on a regular basis can lead to greater feelings of happiness, contentment, and overall well-being.
